required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Investigate the Safety, Efficacy and PK of Multiple Doses of QL-007 in Chronic Hepatitis B Patients in CHINA
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-Label Phase 1b Study to Evaluate the Dose-Related Safety, Efficacy, and Pharmacokinetic Profile of Different Doses of QL-007 in Chronic Hepatitis B Patients

brief_summary.textblock: This is a randomized, open-label, positive-control, dose-escalation Phase 1b trial in 60 patients with chronic HBV infection to determine the safety, preliminary efficacy, and pharmacokinetics (PK) of QL-007 after administration over 28 days of multiple oral doses in a fasted state at the following planned dose levels: 200, 400, and then 600 mg.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a randomized, open-label, positive-control, dose-escalation Phase 1b trial in 60 patients with chronic HBV infection to determine the safety, preliminary efficacy, and pharmacokinetics (PK) of QL-007 after administration over 28 days of multiple oral doses in a fasted state at the following planned dose levels: 200, 400, and then 600 mg.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in serum HBV DNA from baseline at Day3, 8, 15, 22 and 28
primary_outcome.time_frame: Time Frame: Day 1, Day 3, Day 8, Day 15, Day 22 and Day 28
primary_outcome.description: Blood samples will be collected on Day -1 , 1, 3, 8, 15, 22, 28 and the follow-up 7 ±1 days

secondary_outcome.measure: Peak Plasma Concentration (Cmax) of QL-007 following multiple doses
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Days 1, 3, 8, 15, 22, and 28. On Days 1, 3, 8, 15, 22, and 28, samples will be collected predose; on Days 1 and 28, samples will also be collected at 0.25h, 0.5h, 0.75h, 1h, 1.5h, 2h, 3h, 4h, 6h, 8h, 10h, 12h and 24h postdose
secondary_outcome.description: Concentrations of QL-007 in plasma will be collected on Day 1, Day 3, Day 8, Day 15, Day 22 and Day 28.

secondary_outcome.measure: The time to Cmax (tmax) of QL-007 following multiple doses
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Days 1, 3, 8, 15, 22, and 28. On Days 1, 3, 8, 15, 22, and 28, samples will be collected predose; on Days 1 and 28, samples will also be collected at 0.25h, 0.5h, 0.75h, 1h, 1.5h, 2h, 3h, 4h, 6h, 8h, 10h, 12h and 24h postdose
secondary_outcome.description: Concentrations of QL-007 in plasma will be collected on Day 1, Day 3, Day 8, Day 15, Day 22 and Day 28.

secondary_outcome.measure: AUC0-t (area under the plasma concentration versus time curve) of QL-007 following multiple doses
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Days 1, 3, 8, 15, 22, and 28. On Days 1, 3, 8, 15, 22, and 28, samples will be collected predose; on Days 1 and 28, samples will also be collected at 0.25h, 0.5h, 0.75h, 1h, 1.5h, 2h, 3h, 4h, 6h, 8h, 10h, 12h and 24h postdose
secondary_outcome.description: Concentrations of QL-007 in plasma will be collected on Day 1, Day 3, Day 8, Day 15, Day 22 and Day 28.

secondary_outcome.measure: AUC0-∞ of QL-007 following multiple doses following multiple doses
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Days 1, 3, 8, 15, 22, and 28. On Days 1, 3, 8, 15, 22, and 28, samples will be collected predose; on Days 1 and 28, samples will also be collected at 0.25h, 0.5h, 0.75h, 1h, 1.5h, 2h, 3h, 4h, 6h, 8h, 10h, 12h and 24h postdose
secondary_outcome.description: Concentrations of QL-007 in plasma will be collected on Day 1, Day 3, Day 8, Day 15, Day 22 and Day 28.

secondary_outcome.measure: t1/2 (terminal elimination half-life) of QL-007 following multiple doses
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Days 1, 3, 8, 15, 22, and 28. On Days 1, 3, 8, 15, 22, and 28, samples will be collected predose; on Days 1 and 28, samples will also be collected at 0.25h, 0.5h, 0.75h, 1h, 1.5h, 2h, 3h, 4h, 6h, 8h, 10h, 12h and 24h postdose
secondary_outcome.description: Concentrations of QL-007 in plasma will be collected on Day 1, Day 3, Day 8, Day 15, Day 22 and Day 28.

secondary_outcome.measure: Vz/F(apparent volume of distribution for the terminal disposition phase) of QL-007 following multiple doses
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Days 1, 3, 8, 15, 22, and 28. On Days 1, 3, 8, 15, 22, and 28, samples will be collected predose; on Days 1 and 28, samples will also be collected at 0.25h, 0.5h, 0.75h, 1h, 1.5h, 2h, 3h, 4h, 6h, 8h, 10h, 12h and 24h postdose
secondary_outcome.description: Concentrations of QL-007 in plasma will be collected on Day 1, Day 3, Day 8, Day 15, Day 22 and Day 28.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in serum HBsAg from baseline at Day 1, Day 3, Day 8, Day 15, Day 22 and Day 28
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Time Frame: Day 1, Day 3, Day 8, Day 15, Day 22 and Day 28
secondary_outcome.description: Blood samples will be collected on Day -1 , 1, 3, 8, 15, 22, 28 and the follow-up 7 ±1 days

arm_group.description: Tablet QL-007 will be administered orally daily (200 mg QD) over the 28 days under fasted state. Patients fast for 10h before administration and 1h after administration.
Tablet QL-007 will be administered orally daily (400 mg QD) over the 28 days under fasted state. Patients fast for 10h before administration and 1h after administration.
Tablet QL-007 will be administered orally daily (600 mg QD) over the 28 days under fasted state. Patients fast for 10h before administration and 1h after administration.
Tablet QL-007 will be administered orally daily (100 mg BID) over the 28 days under fasted state. Patients fast for 2h before administration and 1h after administration.
Tablet QL-007 will be administered orally daily (200 mg BID) over the 28 days under fasted state. Patients fast for 2h before administration and 1h after administration.
TDF will be administered orally daily (300 mg QD) over the 28 days not request fast .

intervention.description: QL-007 will be administered orally daily over the 28 days under fasted state.
TDF will be administered orally daily over the 28 days e.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Chronic Hepatitis B infection, defined as positive test for Hepatitis B surface antigen (HBsAg) for more than 6 months prior to randomization
- HBV DNA at screening greater than or equal to (>/=) 2 × 10^4 international units per milliliter (IU/mL) for Hepatitis B e antigen (HBeAg) positive participants, or >/=2 × 10^3 IU/mL for HBeAg-negative participants
- ALT> 1 x upper limit of normal (ULN) and < 10 x upper limit of normal (ULN)
- Anti-HBV treatment-naive adults; adults who have taken oral anti-HBV nucleoside therapy with the last dose ≥4 weeks prior to screening are also eligible.
- Signed informed consent.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Known co-infection with HIV, hepatitis C virus (HCV) or hepatitis D virus (HDV)
- Presence of autoimmune disorders
- History of liver disease other than Hepatitis B
- History of Gilbert's Disease
- Any sign of decompensated liver disease
- Known or suspected cirrhosis
- Evidence of hepatocellular carcinoma
- Patient has clinically significant, uncontrolled heart disease and/or recent cardiac event (within 6 months)
- Pregnant or lactating females
- Diabetes
- Alcohol or substance abuse
- History of bleeding diathesis
- Patients with a history of seizures, central nervous system disorders or psychiatric disability thought to be clinically significant in the opinion of the investigator.
- History of clinically significant gastrointestinal, cardiovascular, endocrine, renal, ocular, pulmonary, psychiatric or neurological disease.
